DESCRIPTION: Reviews basic geometric terms (point, line, plane), how to interpret and label geometric figures, and 5 basic postulates for points, lines, planes, and intersections.
Reviews how to measure the distance between two points and the Ruler Postulate. Also introduces congruency/congruent segments and midpoint.
Reviews angle nomenclature, how to measure angles, different types of angles, congruent angles, and angle pairs.
Looks at symbolic notation used in logic, inductive reasoning (patterns), and deductive reasoning.
Reviews conditional statements and related conditionals (converse, negation, inverse, contrapositive), biconditional statements, compound statements, and truth tables.

Introduces proofs: algebraic proof, properties of congruence, and geometric proofs (two-column)
.
Overview of notation and basic postulates/theorems for parallel and perpendicular lines.
Defines angles formed by transverals and reviews more postulates and theorems of parallel and perpendicular lines.
Looks at the slopes of parallel/perpendicular lines and how to graph and derive equations for parallel/perpendicular lines.
Reviews terminology for triangles, different types of triangles, and interior and exterior angles theorems.

EIDs: MAT.GEO.322.L.1, MAT.GEO.324.L.1, MAT.GEO.326.L.1, MAT.GEO.332.L.1, MAT.GEO.334.L.1, MAT.GEO.336.L.1, MAT.GEO.338.L.1
DESCRIPTION: Overview of triangle congruence: defining corresponding parts of congruent triangles, postulates and theorems for congruences (SSS, SAS, AAS, ASA), and postulates and theorems for congruences for special triangles.
Looks at theorems and definitions for midsegments, bisectors, medians, and altitudes.
Brief review of the triangle inequality theorem and hinge theorem.
Introduction to polygons - convex vs concave, interior and exterior angles, and basic terminology for common polygons.
Looks at properties of parallelograms and special parallelograms (rectangle, rhombus, square), theorems about parallelograms and special parallelograms, and how to identify special parallelograms.
Looks at properties and theorems about trapezoids and kites.
Reviews ratios, proportions, and cross-multiplication.
Looks at similar polygons, scale factor (ratio), and triangle similarity.
Looks at proportionality theorems for triangles and parallel lines intersected by transversals.
A very brief overview on several examples of self-similarity.
Overview of the Pythagorean theorem and its converse, Pythagorean triples, and proving the distance formula.
Overview of altitudes and geometric mean.
Looks at the trigonometric ratios sine, cosine, tangent, and their inverses. Also reviews the laws of sine and cosine.
Reviews the special triangles: 45-45-90, 30-60-90, and equilateral triangle.
Reviews the terminology for circles (tangent, arcs, central angles) and the equation for a circle.
Looks at radian and theorems of arcs and angles.
Looks at theorems for inscribed angles and polygons.
Looks at theorems for chords, secants, and tangents (of a circle).
Looks at the perimeter, area, circumference, perimeters and areas for different types of regular polygons, such as rectangles, parallelograms, triangles, trapezoids, and rhombuses.
Overview of the formulas for the perimeter and area of triangles and different types of quadrilaterals.
Overview of the formulas for circumference, arc length, sectors, and segments of circles.
Reviews how to classify polyhedra, Euler's formula, and regular polyhedra.
Overview of isometric view, orthographic view, cross section, and nets.
Looks at the definitions and postulates of surface area and volume, Cavalieri's principle, and composite solids.
Reviews the surface area and volume of prisms and cylinders.
Reviews the surface area and volume of pyramids and cones.
Looks at the characteristics of spheres, surface area, and volume of spheres.
Overview of reflection, rotation, translation, and dilation.
A look at glides, multiple reflections, and multiple rotations.
Brief overview of the different types of symmetry and tessellations.
